column4: Hi, I just installed Ubuntu 9.10 with wubi over an old windows7 partition and now when I select Ubuntu at the boot menu I get to the GRUB command line. Btw, Windows 7 is still in the boot options but obviously doesn't work anymore.
were you hoping to keep that windows installation?
nope, I formatted the partition before using wubi anyways.
well thats a problem, as wubi installed ubuntu into a page file (of sorts) insode the windows partition.. you just nuked everything
I'm not too worried, I still have access to my windows vista partition (using it right now)
ok, in control panel, look for Administration tools, and Disk Manager
remove just the win 7, as your ubuntu install will be fixe by installing ubuntu the normal way (or wubi again, if you prefer)
you should have an MBR tool somewhere in the lists of tools
there's no windows7 partition that i can delete. Here's a screenshot: http://imgur.com/iNW6L.png
ewww. .i cant understand your language man. your looking for Master Boot Record
ouch. I don't see anything that looks like MBR. I'll try rebooting and look again for any specific error message.

hmm things didn't improve. I removed windows 7 from the boot options, and for some reason I now have to manually tell the BIOS which hard drive to boot from. Also I didn't see anything special on the GRUB CLI, but when I enter the command "boot" it tells me "no kernel loaded".
ok, no, your situation has improved marginally, now you need to reinstall ubuntu again, this time from the graphical installer with the disk in the drive at boot
ok, I'll burn a live cd and move on from here.
